title: Magnetic force - cart_loop moving through B-field

content.question: A rectangular conducting loop of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is attached to a cart of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>. The cart rolls down a ramp onto a horizontal surface of negligible friction and through an area with uniform magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math> directed out of the page. The cart moves a horizontal distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> while in the field, and then moves out of the field and up another ramp identical to the first. Which of the following modifications would decrease the maximum height of the cart on the second ramp?

choices.label: Increasing the magnetic field strength <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>.
Increasing the horizontal distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>.

content.answer: Increasing the magnetic field strength <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>.
